info.title: SMSQueue API
info.description: Allows you to create and queue a SMS message, get delivery details of a SMS message and retrieve information related to cost centres, campaigns and message templates.

post.description: Creates and queues a new SMS message for delivery.

Message_Request.title: Message_Request
Message_Request.description: The request schema of the Message POST operation.

messageOptions.description: The options for the SMS message being created.

costCentreId.description: The cost centre to use for the delivery of the SMS message. Use GET /CostCentres to retrieve a list of available cost centres.

campaignId.description: The campaign to associate the SMS message with. Campaigns are used to drive reporting, and any replies to SMS messages will be routed to the email address associated with the campaign.

templateId.description: The message body templatte ID to use for this message. If specified then the 'bosy' parameter must be either empty or contain a JSON array of template parameters and values.

groupMessage.description: If the value of this parameter is 'true', the value of the 'recipient' parameter must contain the name of the group instead of the recipient MSISDN.

source.description: The source is the name of the calling application or system, and will be stored against the created message for reporting purposes.

reference.description: The reference should contain a value that will uniquely identify the SMS message delivery request on the calling application or system.

recipient.description: The recipient must either be a MSISDN in a valid format or the name of the group in the case of a group message.

Message_Response.title: Message_Response

success.description: A boolean value indicating if the SMS message was successfully created.

errorDescription.description: In the event of an error, contains a description of the validation or processing error encountered.

messageId.description: The unique ID of the SMS message. Can be used to retrieve updated message information and delivery reports.
